# Starry Skies and Sacred Memories
## Scripture
"But God remembered Noah and all the wild animals and the livestock that were with him in the ark, and he sent a wind over the earth, and the waters receded." - Genesis 8:1

## Reflection
As we gaze up at the starry skies during this winter season, we're reminded of the countless memories etched in God's mind. Just as the stars twinkle with a light that's been traveling through space for years, God's memories of us are eternal and unwavering. In Genesis 8:1, we see God's remarkable ability to remember Noah and his family, even in the midst of chaos and destruction. This verse speaks to God's sovereign care and faithfulness, reassuring us that He is always mindful of our lives and our stories.

## Prayer
Dear Heavenly Father, as we marvel at the beauty of the night sky, we're struck by the depth of Your memories and the richness of Your love. Help us to trust in Your faithfulness, just as Noah trusted in Your promise. May the stars above remind us of the sacred memories You hold, and may we find comfort in the knowledge that You are always with us, guiding and caring for us. Thank You for being a God who remembers and loves us with an everlasting love. Amen.
